#Text=Wikinews interviews novelist Jeremy Robinson
#Text=Thursday , March 13 , 2008
#Text=Wikinews held an exclusive interview with Jeremy Robinson , the bestselling American author from Massachusetts who wrote the thrillers
#Text=The Didymus Contingency , Raising the Past and Antarktos Rising .
#Text=Before deciding to take up the writing of fiction , Robinson was an artist and moviemaker .
#Text=He says of his years before getting published , " I lived well under the poverty line ... . . so I could write .

column1: #Text=Robinson is currently at work on two other novels .
#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) : You 've written three novels . Tell us about them .
#Text=Mr. Robinson : I 've actually written six novels , three of which are published , and they 're all very different from each other .

#Text=Focusing on the three published books ; my first novel The Didymus Contingency is a time travel thriller where the main characters go back in time , one of them to disprove the story of Jesus , the other to stop him .

#Text=My second novel , Raising the Past , is a straight forward sci-fi , arctic thriller that launches into action when a team of scientists discovers an alien artifact clutched in the arms of a woman ... whose frozen inside the belly of a preserved mammoth .
#Text=The newest of the three published , and my favorite , is Antarktos Rising .
#Text=This story starts off with a global catastrophe as the Earth 's crust shifts moving the North Pole to North Dakota and Antarctica ( Antarktos ) to the equator .

#Text=2.6 billion people die in the first few chapters and the ravaged world turns to Antarctica as a new promised land ... but the continent has already been claimed by the Nephilim-bad guys straight out of the book of Genesis .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) :
#Text=What inspires you to write ?
#Text=Mr. Robinson :
#Text=I suppose I was born with an insatiable appetite for story telling .
#Text=When I was younger I expressed this through art , and to an extent still do .
#Text=I was an illustration major in college and began illustrating comics after college .
#Text=But writing crept in and hooked me .
#Text=It 's a much satisfying way to flesh out a story and the world the characters live in-more than comics , more than movies ( both of which I tried before making the final switch to novels ) .
#Text=As far as day to day inspiration .
#Text=I suppose I would say nature .
#Text=The power and mysteriousness of it .
#Text=Primarily the ocean .
#Text=A day on the ocean can power a month of writing .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) :
#Text=What sets your books apart from the rest how are they different , unique ?
#Text=Mr. Robinson :
#Text=I would say my ability to tackle heavy , sometimes even controversial topics in a fun way .
#Text=Didymus tackles the life , death and resurrection of Jesus . Antarktos covers creationism vs. evolution , a genetic cause for Noah 's flood and the account of the Nephilim in Genesis .

#Text=But because I 'm not writing with the intent of convert people to any idea , philosophy or religion ( because I do n't necessarily agree with the viewpoints of my characters-they 're their own people ) they do n't read as being preachy or antagonistic .
#Text=So I 'm able to handle religious topics in mainstream thrillers that are otherwise relegated to Christian fiction-meaning they 're written for Christians .
#Text=I chose to write this way because I can handle topics and concepts that are exciting while concentrating on making the pace breakneck , the plot twisting and the characters enjoyable .
#Text=I do n't get bogged down by trying to prove a personal point of view .
#Text=In my upcoming series I do the same thing , but with mythology as opposed to Biblical topics ... which leads to the next question .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) : Will you be writing another novel soon ?
#Text=Mr. Robinson :
#Text=I am currently writing two novels ( my seventh and eighth ) .
#Text=The first , ACHE , deals with the subject of hell , but I 'm keeping the story under wraps .
#Text=Do n't want to kill the surprise .

#Text=The second novel I 'm working on now , ROUSE , is the first book in a three book series that I 've just signed on with St. Martins Press to write ! This deal was actually just announced today , so I 'm pretty excited .
#Text=The series follows a team of Delta Force operatives known as the Chess Team : King , Queen , Knight , Rook , Bishop and their handler Deep Blue .

#Text=In book one they battle a terrorist-friendly biopharmaceutical company working on human limb regeneration , whose experiments unleash the pinnacle of physical regeneration-the ancient creature known as the Hydra .
#Text=This is James Rollins meets Matthew Reilly .
#Text=Should be a ton of fun .
#Text=The first book comes out Spring/Summer 2009 .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) : Is there any advice you can give some of the authors reading this who are struggling with their writing ?
#Text=Mr. Robinson : There is a lot of stereotypical advice for this question .
#Text=Some say write a page a day .
#Text=Some say to have someone other than your mother critique your work .
#Text=It 's all good advice .
#Text=But my experience has taught me that a ridiculous amount of commitment can make big things happen .
#Text=When I wrote my first fiction it was abysmal .
#Text=Absolute garbage .
#Text=That was ten years ago .
#Text=Here 's what I did in the past ten years to get to my St. Martin 's deal .
#Text=Wrote six novels .
#Text=Wrote twenty-something short stories .
#Text=Wrote thirteen screenplays .
#Text=Interned at an agency .
#Text=Self-published the first edition of Didymus Contingecy .
#Text=Went with a small press for the next two .
#Text=Rewrote the majority of all the previous writing several times .
#Text=That 's really an insane amount of work , the majority of it not making me a dime .
#Text=I lived well under the poverty line for years so I could write .
#Text=The point is , do not expect to write a novel , sell and hit the NY Times bestseller list .
#Text=It 's more likely you 'll spend the next ten years trying ... and that 's if you spend 30 - 40 hours a week on your writing like I have .
#Text=Could take fifteen years .
#Text=But if you want it .
#Text=If you really want it and ca n't imagine doing anything , you 'll enjoy the process ... though perhaps not the Ramen Noodles .
#Text=My only other advice is to become a master at marketing and self-promotion .
#Text=Publishers are really looking for authors who know how to build an audience and kick start word-of-mouth .
